00001         <h2>Monitor battery status with style</h2>
00002         <p class="centered">
00003                 <object classid="clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000" codebase="http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,0,0" width="145" height="71">
00004                         <param name="menu" value="false" />
00005                         <param name="movie" value="arcoiris.swf" />
00006                         <param name="quality" value="high" />
00007                         <param name="bgcolor" value="#FFFFFF" />
00008                         <embed name="arcoiris" src="/assets/images/software/widgets/minibatterystatus/arcoiris.swf" width="145" height="71" quality="high" bgcolor="#FFFFFF" menu="false" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" pluginspage="http://www.macromedia.com/go/getflashplayer" />
00009                 </object>
00010         </p>
00011         <p>
00012                 MiniBatteryStatus widget monitors battery status and charge percentage. It displays colorful information
00013                 to quickly notice your battery conditions.
00014         </p>
00015         <p>
00016                 The widget assumes different colors depending on the remaining charge of the battery. It is also aware of
00017                 battery charging and plugged status. User can choose if the widget should display percentage, remaining
00018                 time, capacity (current/maximum) and cycle count or just the charge gauge.
00019         </p>
00020         <p>
00021                 MiniBatteryStatus is definitely a must have for all Mac laptop users.
00022         </p>
00023 
00024         <h3>Features</h3>
00025         <ul>
00026                 <li style="padding-right: 65px; background: transparent url('/assets/images/software/widgets/minibatterystatus/growlclawsmall.png') no-repeat top right">
00027                         <strong>Growl integration</strong>. Be aware of what happens to your battery even when you&rsquo;re not
00028                         looking at Dashboard. MiniBatteryStatus tells you when it&rsquo;s time to recharge your battery, when
00029                         you&rsquo;re done charging and when the power source has changed with Growl notifications.
00030                 </li>
00031                 <li>
00032                         <strong>Universal Binary</strong>. You can run MiniBatteryStatus on both PowerPC iBooks and Powerbooks
00033                         and Intel MacBooks and MacBook Pro&rsquo;s.
00034                 </li>
00035                 <li>
00036                         <strong>Lots of colors</strong>. Thanks to the revolutionary <strong><em>&ldquo;arcoiris&rdquo; engine</em></strong>,
00037                         the widget color varies with continuity from green to red. Enjoy a plenty of awesome <em>nuances</em>
00038                         from acid green to coral red.
00039                 </li>
00040                 <li>
00041                         <strong>Small widget size to save Dashboard real estate</strong>. iBooks and powerbooks have limited
00042                         desktop surface. Leave room to other cumbersome widgets, still monitoring your battery with style and no clutter.
00043                 </li>
00044                 <li>
00045                         <strong>Rewritten from ground up</strong>. Completely event driven. Same data from the system status item,
00046                         instantaneous notifications.
00047                 </li>
00048                 <li>
00049                         <strong>Share battery data</strong>. The included battery data sharing service will make your battery
00050                         remotely monitorable by <a href="#mbl-ad">MiniBatteryLogger</a>.
00051                         System administrators will be able to monitor the available energy supply of all laptops over
00052                         the local network.
00053                 </li>
00054         </ul>
00055         <p>
00056                 Minimum system requirements are Mac OS X 10.4 &ldquo;Tiger&rdquo; or later, and of course a battery-powered Macintosh.
00057                 Suggestions for improvements are more than welcome. MiniBatteryStatus Widget is freeware, anyway you cannot
00058                 redistribute it without written permission. Please <a href="/contact/">contact me</a> if you&rsquo;d like to
00059                 redistribute the widget.
00060         </p>
00061

00063                 <p style="float:left;margin-right:3em">
00064                         <a href="/software/macosx/minibatterylogger.html"><img
00065                                 src="/assets/images/software/widgets/minibatterystatus/mbl-ad-screenshot.png" alt="MiniBatteryLogger screenshot" /></a>
00066                 </p>
00067                 <h3>MiniBatteryLogger</h3>
00068                 <p>
00069                         <a href="/software/macosx/minibatterylogger.html">MiniBatteryLogger</a> is a powerful application
00070                         that monitors local and remote batteries, plots the graph of charge, voltage and amperage versus time,
00071                         logs relevant power events to file and notifies power changes.
00072                 </p>
00073                 <p>
00074                         MiniBatteryLogger requires Mac OS X 10.3.9 or later.
00075                 </p>
00076         </div>
